revised_title: Weldability and Toughness Specifications for Structural Steels in Japan
tldr: This article discusses the weldability and toughness specifications for structural steels in Japan, focusing on WES-135 and WES-136 standards. It explores the importance of equivalent carbon content, maximum weld hardness, and weld cracking susceptibility in high-strength steel plates. The article also covers the requirements for toughness, including the use of the -value parameter and the correlation between small-scale tests and large-scale brittle crack propagation tests.
